div.p: NotifyBot is our intelligent, scalable solution for email automation. Whether you're sending a handful of emails or thousands, NotifyBot makes it effortless, safe, and efficient.

div.style: background: linear-gradient(135deg, #87ceeb, #b0e0e6); padding: 20px; border-radius: 10px; margin: 15px 0;

ul.li: 📧 Batch Email Sending: Deliver emails in customizable batches
🖋️ HTML Email Support: Rich, styled messages with attachments
🎯 Recipient Filtering: Advanced CSV filtering with regex support
🧪 Test Mode: Use separate test inventory for safe testing
📊 Comprehensive Logging: Detailed audit trails with Splunk integration

div.style: background: #ffe6e6; padding: 15px; border-left: 6px solid #cc0000; margin: 20px 0; border-radius: 6px;

div.div:
🚨 Critical Safety Guidelines
🧪 Always run NotifyBot in --dry-run mode first
🧪 Use --test mode for safe testing
❌ Never use --force without approval
📂 The campaign directory is inside /notifybot/basefolder/

div.p: Test Mode provides a completely safe testing environment using separate inventory data, ensuring production data remains untouched.

ul.li: --test flag: Uses test-inventory.csv instead of production
--test-inventory PATH: Specify custom test file
Complete isolation from production data
Compatible with both dry-run and live modes

div.style: background: #1a1a1a; color: #f8f8f2; padding: 20px; border-radius: 8px; margin: 15px 0; font-family: monospace;
margin: 10px 0; background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05); padding: 10px; border-radius: 5px;

div.div:
# Test mode with dry-run (safest approach)
/notifybot/venv/bin/python notifybot.py --base-folder campaign --test --dry-run
# Test mode with custom inventory
/notifybot/venv/bin/python notifybot.py --base-folder campaign --test-inventory /path/to/test.csv --dry-run
# Live test mode
/notifybot/venv/bin/python notifybot.py --base-folder campaign --test
